reviews.text: Russell’s adaptation illustrates a heartwarming and hilariously realistic tale that has complications but creates such an overall admiration for the film and its characters.
reviews.author: Tania Hussain

reviews.text: Russell has provided us with a smart, satisfying antidote to the anti-rom-com. I think it’s safe to say success suits him pretty well.
reviews.author: Michael Leader

reviews.text: Fueled by unexpected dramatic turns and a gamut of oddball hang-ups that set the comic tone, Silver Linings Playbook marks another decisive triumph for David O. Russell, who’s made both the funniest film and the most heartening romance in recent memory.
reviews.author: Brian Eggert

reviews.text: It’s a sharp romantic comedy that avoids the usual pitfalls associated with the genre today – that is right up until the end.
reviews.author: Keith Garlington

reviews.text: What really sells "Silver Linings Playbook" are Cooper and Lawrence's incredible performances and chemistry.
reviews.author: Ema Sasic

reviews.text: A romantic salad with a dressing for the masses. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Antonio Trashorras

reviews.text: A terrific, if slightly less punchy, follow-up to writer-director David O. Russell's The Fighter.
reviews.author: James Croot

reviews.text: Takes the audience through the emotional wringer but sends them out of the theater on a high note.
reviews.author: Kip Mooney

reviews.text: Frustrating as it can be to watch, nixing nuance for a heavy-handed storyline that convinces viewers of Pat and Tiffany's humanity is forgivable.
reviews.author: Katie Presley

reviews.text: It's Lawrence's turn as Tiffany that will likely get the most praise, once again revealing her versatility and range.
reviews.author: Mike Massie

reviews.text: Robert De Niro finally once again finds a film worthy of his talent.
reviews.author: Richard Propes

reviews.text: This is a truly delightful comedy drama. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Yasser Medina

reviews.text: David O. Russell's eccentric Philly-cheesesteak screwball comedy leaves me cold, but may prove to be his big crossover hit.
reviews.author: David Lamble

reviews.text: You have crazy, raised by crazy, befriended by crazy, thinking crazy, advised by crazy, dreaming crazy, and in love with crazy all happening in a crazy city of of crazy sports fans.
reviews.author: Don Shanahan

reviews.text: Russell has adapted the script to highlight the difficulties of the characters - whether it is mental illness, friendship problems or just plain closure - to a bittersweet effect.
reviews.author: Katie Smith-Wong

reviews.text: In Silver Linings Playbook, David O. Russell sets his dysfunctional love story against a working class neighborhood in Philadelphia and he totally nails it.
reviews.author: David Harris

reviews.text: This is a movie worth any movie lover's time and money.
reviews.author: Leslie Combemale

reviews.text: Although Silver Linings Playbook is high-concept fare, it doesn't feel formulaic. The story unfolds with such loopy, oddball energy that you almost forget it's a romantic comedy.
reviews.author: Brian D. Johnson

reviews.text: Fans of Russell's earlier films might lament his new career path as him selling out, but doing so doesn't give him enough credit. His work is still subversive, but now it's getting him better results.
reviews.author: C.J. Prince

reviews.text: A perfect storm of great writing and expert performances working in tandem, a rare romantic comedy with both a heart and a brain that rings painfully and beautifully true.
reviews.author: Mattie Lucas

reviews.text: It's charming and challenging, even as it starts to conform to the romantic comedy playbook.
reviews.author: Micheal Compton

reviews.text: Despite its flaws, it's got romance AND sports AND funny family drama AND a really hilariously amazing can't stop laughing about it dance scene.
reviews.author: Amie Simon

reviews.text: Though Silver Linings deserves credit for its portrayal of the middle ground of mental illness, it's as much of a mess as its characters, veering between tone-deafness and deep sympathy, convincing portrayal and cheap cliché.
reviews.author: Molly Templeton

reviews.text: Lawrence, so good in Winter's Bone, comes as a revelation.
reviews.author: Kelly Jane Torrance

reviews.text: One of the most charming Hollywood screwball comedies of recent years.
reviews.author: PJ Nabarro

reviews.text: In any event, this is a refreshing and extremely well-acted film.
reviews.author: Debbie Baldwin

reviews.text: The movie is a mess, but a glorious, big-hearted, beautifully acted one.
reviews.author: Tara Thorne

reviews.text: Despite the film's flaws, Russell excels at creating a community of misfits around Pat and Tiffany.
reviews.author: Steve Erickson

reviews.text: Silver Linings Playbook may well be my favourite movie of the year. Go see it. Like, right now.
reviews.author: Jennifer Heaton

reviews.text: Cooper manages to show that he is still capable of doing more than his traditional throw-away, comedic roles.
reviews.author: Joseph Walsh

reviews.text: Although the story sometimes drags and the predictable rom-com ending feels too pat, "Silver Linings Playbook" scores some intriguing insights into what mental illnesses we consider socially acceptable.
reviews.author: Brandy McDonnell

reviews.text: Thanks to some truly terrific acting and amusing subplots with Pat's parents, the story works.
reviews.author: Megan Basham

reviews.text: Playing outspoken, emotionally damaged young widow Tiffany, Lawrence is a firecracker, a powder keg, a force of nature.
reviews.author: Emma Dibdin

reviews.text: Silver Linings Playbook is difficult to like, and too long, with a climactic dance scene that is filmically botched, which is fine with the movie because according to the plot it did not have to be good to succeed.
reviews.author: A.S. Hamrah

reviews.text: Russell's smart, snappy script is delivered by a top-notch cast, including two thoroughly likeable and well-matched leads.
reviews.author: Lisa Mullen

reviews.text: Once Silver Linings Playbook gets close to Lawrence, it doesn't have to crowd her again...She holds up her head, breathes hard and glows.
reviews.author: Stuart Klawans

reviews.text: Silver Linings Playbook gives us four performers to relish.
reviews.author: Kong Rithdee

reviews.text: It's a challenging picture, but it runs the gamut of emotions so well that it's nearly impossible to dislike.
reviews.author: J. Olson

reviews.text: Wouldn't it be great if mental illness really was as adorable as it is in the movies?
reviews.author: Sean Burns

reviews.text: "Silver Linings Playbook" makes comic hay from bipolar illness, early death, sexual adventurism, self-improvement binges, football fanaticism, degenerate gambling and father-son estrangement, as one would expect from latter-day Russell movies.
reviews.author: Ray Pride

reviews.text: But Silver Linings Playbook never induces a roll of the eyes, even if it never really surprises.
reviews.author: Emma Myers

reviews.text: In an age when the concept of comedies about possible kinships between characters is dominated by sugary devices and contrivance, here at last is a movie about real situations, real people and the natural experiences that evolve from them.
reviews.author: David Keyes

reviews.text: A unique dramedy that stands heads and shoulders above most romantic films.
reviews.author: John Hanlon

reviews.text: A wild mess, but what a mess it is.
reviews.author: Will Leitch

reviews.text: It finds the gentle balance between traditional romantic comedy and artistic exploration of the laws of attraction.
reviews.author: Wesley Lovell

reviews.text: A romantic comedy for people who don't like what Hollywood has been calling 'romantic comedies' these days.
reviews.author: Margot Harrison

reviews.text: One of the most pleasurably offbeat experiences since the Philadelphia Eagles last enjoyed a winning season.
reviews.author: Al Alexander

reviews.text: A deft treatment of its delicate subject material and some remarkable performances that give the film both touching, raw, authentic emotion and a certain kinetic humor.
reviews.author: Bruce Bennett

reviews.text: Jennifer Lawrence is the only aspect of the film that truly lives up to the trumped-up awards buzz and hype, but being a perfectly enjoyable light comedy with heaps of heart is no small feat in itself.
reviews.author: Michael Dequina

reviews.text: I love the work that deNiro and Lawrence do here, but ultimately all they do is prove the old adage that you can cover up a lot of problems with the script by hiring good actors.
reviews.author: Dan Jardine

reviews.text: "Silver Linings Playbook" could not be a more awkward love story. But I loved every second of it!
reviews.author: Jolene Mendez

reviews.text: Silver Linings Playbook looks like your run-of-the-mill wacky family comedy, but it's an important film and a great one that deserves to sweep the awards it's nominated for.
reviews.author: Rima Sabina Aouf

reviews.text: Silver Linings Playbook is defined by the positive decisions that are made in the face of imperfection, desperation, and the desolate wasteland of your world in pieces.
reviews.author: Blake Howard

reviews.text: Director David O. Russell forms a unique and incredible romance dramedy...
reviews.author: Felix Vasquez Jr.

reviews.text: There is some charm to the story, but the final act is very neat, predictable, contrived, and not up to originality of the first two.
reviews.author: Mark R. Leeper

reviews.text: Director David O. Russell is a little too chipper at times - breaking a restraining order is really no joke - but he brings a breeziness to this likeable tale of two misfits trying to make it work.
reviews.author: Jim Schembri

reviews.text: It may be a Hollywood comedy, but it's one that feels beautifully alive.
reviews.author: Cara Nash

reviews.text: On the surface Silver Linings Playbook is a raucous romantic comedy, but its real interests are superstition and delusion.
reviews.author: Mark Pfeiffer

reviews.text: A volatile mix of familial drama and madcap comedy, infectious optimism and razor-wire wit, it's one of the most purely enjoyable films released in the past twelve months.
reviews.author: Tom Clift

reviews.text: Parece desistir de qualquer traço de originalidade em seu clímax, quando se entrega a todos os clichês do gênero: mal-entendidos, mocinhos obrigados a correr atrás da mocinha pela rua e, claro, o insuportável travelling circular do beijo romântico.
reviews.author: Pablo Villaça

reviews.text: I suppose the phrase 'serious romantic comedy' sounds like a paradox. But that's exactly what 'Silver Linings Playbook' is: an intelligent, edgy dark comedy with romance at its core.
reviews.author: Linda Cook

reviews.text: This is a rom-com dressed up as an Oscar-baiting "dramedy". It's a good rom-com thanks to it's edge... but occasionally has the bad traits of a bad rom-com.
reviews.author: Matt Neal

reviews.text: Silver Linings Playbook puts the "fun" in "dysfunction." And sure, that sounds glib, but actually, it's a rather extraordinary achievement. Especially when you're skirting on the edges of sanity.
reviews.author: Alice Tynan

reviews.text: A bittersweet pill that's a mixture of an endearing family drama and modern romance that's an absolute delight.
reviews.author: Cameron Williams

reviews.text: tows the line of conventional, feel-good Hollywood rom-com, albeit dressed up in just enough art-house quirk to make it feel like something slightly radical
reviews.author: James Kendrick

reviews.text: A reminder that 'sanity' doesn't make your flaws any more orderly.
reviews.author: Liam Maguren

reviews.text: Silver Linings Playbook is a fine, funny film, and one that should charm viewers who haven't been tricked by all those Oscar nominations into anticipating it as some kind of world-changing work of art for the ages.
reviews.author: Simon Miraudo

reviews.text: David O. Russell's latest buzz film straddles a fine line between farce and kitchen-sink drama before settling into a groove that gets under one's skin.
reviews.author: Ed Gibbs

reviews.text: It starts to fray about halfway through as it shifts into a more conventional mode, taking on the usual trappings of the genre and making its way to a predictable resolution
reviews.author: Andrew L. Urban

reviews.text: Both charming and gritty... Cooper is edgy, while Lawrence is dynamite
reviews.author: Louise Keller

reviews.text: If there's one reason why you should see this film, it's to admire the wonderful performances from Bradley Cooper and Jennifer Lawrence.
reviews.author: Matthew Toomey

reviews.text: Cooper and Lawrence Shine in Linings.
reviews.author: Charles Koplinski

reviews.text: Writer-director Russell is just the guy to bring out (and then calm) the manic dysfunction in these folks.
reviews.author: Bob Mondello

reviews.text: Down-to-earth, funnier than you'd expect, and sympathetic toward its volatile, damaged characters.
reviews.author: Eric D. Snider

reviews.text: Just the sheer number of characters flitting around, each scrambling for plot space, gives an idea of just how frantic this movie can be. But Russell expertly uses all of it for maximum emotional -- and sometimes physical -- impact.
reviews.author: Jeffrey M. Anderson

reviews.text: Yes, the marketing presents it as a big broad comedy -- and it certainly is -- but it's also a unique and involving tale of two outsiders who together find a way to get on with life after it has dealt them some bad hands.
reviews.author: Kevin Jagernauth

reviews.text: The absence of bigger social and psychic realities in Silver Linings Playbook is a serious artistic failing.
reviews.author: Joanne Laurier

reviews.text: Cooper and Lawrence radiate off each other as they run both physically and mentally away from (and towards) each other.
reviews.author: Allison Loring

reviews.text: A cinematic high-wire act that audaciously blends edgy comedy together with genuinely touching drama into one of the most purely and surprisingly entertaining movies of the year.
reviews.author: Peter Sobczynski

reviews.text: It's tough to go wrong when your movie features two of the hottest stars, but director David O. Russell doesn't stop there.
reviews.author: Chris Knight

reviews.text: When Lawrence and Cooper are together, their chemistry jumps and sparks and their rat-a-tat psycho-banter aims for Cary Grant and Rosalind Russell territory.
reviews.author: Dave White

reviews.text: Director David O. Russell, who adapted the novel, and his cast fill the story with engaging, believable characters.
reviews.author: Nell Minow

reviews.text: Fine mainstream sitcom material.
reviews.author: Dennis Schwartz

reviews.text: Writer-director David O. Russell keeps the audience guessing. He takes unexpected twists and turns as if defying you to guess what will come next.
reviews.author: Bob Bloom

reviews.text: Consistently engaging, funny, and touching. This is the kind of picture in which two hours of running time whiz by in a flash.
reviews.author: Mike McGranaghan

reviews.text: Silver Linings Playbook is the best movie of 2012 and the acting is mind-boggling good. Give me the Oscar picks, and it wins in every nominated category.
reviews.author: Gary Wolcott

reviews.text: Succeeds less on the merits of aesthetics than its willingness to give in to crowd-pleasing effervescence.
reviews.author: Rob Humanick

reviews.text: A quirky, dramatic and totally entertaining movie that features someof the best acting of the year.
reviews.author: Jackie K. Cooper

reviews.text: Having gone from unknown actress to Oscar nominee to "The Hunger Games" in what seemed like a blink of an eye, Lawrence shows herself a master of timing and plays off Cooper brilliantly.
reviews.author: Michael A. Smith

reviews.text: Silver Linings Playbook doesn't settle for the routine or the cliché. It's a funny drama about imperfect people looking for love. It also happens to be the best romantic comedy in years.
reviews.author: Kirk Baird

reviews.text: It's a rom-com that succeeds in revitalizing that discredited genre where so many others have failed, injecting it with the grit and emotion of realist drama rather than with amped-up whimsy or social satire or montages of people walking on the beach.
reviews.author: Andrew O'Hehir

reviews.text: Unique, beguiling, and occasionally frustrating: These descriptions equally apply to Silver Linings Playbook and its two central characters.
reviews.author: Tim Grierson

reviews.text: A crazy beaut of a comedy that brims with generosity and manages to circumvent predictability at every turn.
reviews.author: Lisa Schwarzbaum

reviews.text: Russell keeps the outcome interesting; he knows that every silver lining has a cloud.
reviews.author: Peter Keough

reviews.text: A feel-good film filled with laughs and memorable performances, David O. Russell's Silver Linings Playbook leaves you so ecstatically happy that it might just be the most recommendable movie of 2012.
reviews.author: Perry Seibert

reviews.text: The plot is clever and a bit unconventional. Bradley Cooper, Jennifer Lawrence and Robert De Niro all turn in wonderful performances in this very funny, very warm comedy.
reviews.author: Robert Roten

reviews.text: During its rocky road to becoming a fractured love story, Silver Linings Playbook and its great ensemble cast run a funny, conflict-mined, even suspenseful path. It's a total winner.
reviews.author: John Wirt

reviews.text: Unlike the usual run-of-the-mill rom-com, this film bristles with life from the central core of the love story, to the quirky band of supporting players who add to the fun.
reviews.author: Lori Hoffman

reviews.text: With "The Silver Linings Playbook," Russell picks up the traditional quirky rom-com genre and shakes it around, just to see what happens. Where it's going is fairly predictable; how it gets there isn't.
reviews.author: Rob Thomas

reviews.text: A tenderhearted tale about two terribly wounded souls who survive by grudgingly leaning on each other's shoulder.
reviews.author: Kam Williams

reviews.text: Your best bet for a movie that will entertain you, make you laugh and maybe even make you tear-up.
reviews.author: Ken Hanke

reviews.text: Russell handles the shifts in tone extremely effectively, and has sacrificed little of his sardonic edge in crafting something this superficially accessible.
reviews.author: Jason Gorber

reviews.text: Funny without being glib, serious without being pretentious or depressing, this is a mature movie with fully realized characters and fine performances.
reviews.author: Greg Maki

reviews.text: Cooper gives a fine performance in a difficult role, but the one who really shines is Lawrence. Beautiful and sexy, she should be up for awards for this one.
reviews.author: Tony Medley

reviews.text: The movie itself is bipolar, full of mounting tension and hilarity like a classic screwball comedy, but it's all just barely skimming above a deep layer of darkness.
reviews.author: Eric Melin

reviews.text: Pat's rhyming relationship with Pat Senior makes the son (played by Bradley Cooper) different from the many other movie manboys you've seen in the past couple of years.
reviews.author: Cynthia Fuchs

reviews.text: delivers the kind of sharply timed laughs that Sturges and Wilder would've appreciated
reviews.author: Jay Antani

reviews.text: There's a lot to like here and with strong performances all-around, a fresh script with characters that sound and act real. Add this film to your essential Oscar viewing game plan.
reviews.author: Jeffrey Lyles

reviews.text: Loaded with pleasant surprises, this adaptation of Matthew Quick's novel combines romantic comedy, dysfunctional family woes and a sense of danger without ever losing its way.
reviews.author: Dan Lybarger

reviews.text: One hundred percent predictable, yet strangely kind of fun.
reviews.author: Kelly Vance

reviews.text: It's honest you see; and honestly, as any fule no, is the bedrock of any successful relationship whether it be between two homo fictives or an audience and their movies.
reviews.author: Ed Whitfield

reviews.text: ...recalls the screwball psychiatry of Russell's earlier efforts, only this time the farce has heart.
reviews.author: Josh Larsen

reviews.text: 'Screwball' is a slang term for 'crazy,' and perhaps this is what inspired writer-director David O. Russell to literalize as well as update the screwball comedy genre here...
reviews.author: John Beifuss

reviews.text: Writer-director David O. Russell's out-of-control filmmaking style is perfectly suited to a romantic-comedy involving mental illness, and he infuses the film with a sparky unpredictability that's echoed in the perfectly graded performances of the cast.
reviews.author: Rich Cline

reviews.text: Smart, funny, great performances
reviews.author: Diana Saenger

reviews.text: Indeed the movie does make you feel quite good about humanity as the final credits roll.
reviews.author: Philip French

reviews.text: ...ultimately unable to wholeheartedly become the feel-good romantic comedy that Russell has clearly intended...
reviews.author: David Nusair

reviews.text: Offers the satisfaction you'd expect from a romcom and feel-good sports movie, but Lawrence and Cooper's delicate treatment of their characters makes it far more than a fleeting source of entertainment.
reviews.author: Perri Nemiroff

reviews.text: Cooper is terrific as a bipolar depressive ( ... ) and Jennifer Lawrence is quite fearsome as Tiffany. Unfortunately, there's also something off-balance about the whole enterprise which repeated American football references will not correct in the UK.
reviews.author: Graham Young

reviews.text: Silver Linings Playbook remains a very classy, acceptably funny slice of comic drama. But that eventual cop-out feels deeply unsatisfactory.
reviews.author: Donald Clarke

reviews.text: Easily overcomes its familiar beats, thanks to a real attention to character detail, a nonjudgmental approach to all the flaws plaguing the players, and a cast that works beautifully together.
reviews.author: Matt Brunson

reviews.text: [H]alf thrilling, as it always is when a movie does well something The Movies don't typically try to do at all, and half uncomfortable, because it's not always easy to watch.
reviews.author: MaryAnn Johanson

reviews.text: Love is not perfect, but it beats the next best thing
reviews.author: Robert Denerstein

reviews.text: This is a date movie that caters to the needs of both men and women: American football and comedy, ballroom dancing and romance. Silver Linings Playbook covers all those bases -- and rises above them too.
reviews.author: Kate Muir

reviews.text: Seeing it a second time has made me love it even more, not always the case.
reviews.author: David Sexton

reviews.text: A charming, touching and funny film, which sits near the top end of the rom-com world.
reviews.author: Alex Zane

reviews.text: There are times when it does something new with the genre - and it does make you care about the protagonists.
reviews.author: Christopher Tookey

reviews.text: A feelgood film that doesn't avoid life's harsh realities, Silver Linings Playbook is heartwarming winter treat.
reviews.author: Henry Fitzherbert

reviews.text: A funny, believable film about the ability of even the damaged and imperfect to earn a little happiness.
reviews.author: Marc Mohan

reviews.text: ... a terrific ensemble comedy about mental illness that achieves just the right balance of humor and poignancy without trivializing or exploiting the affliction at its center.
reviews.author: Todd Jorgenson

reviews.text: If The Fighter, was Russell's take on a sports movie, then Silver Linings Playbook is his version of a romantic comedy, and a delightfully twisted one at that.
reviews.author: Mathew DeKinder

reviews.text: "Silver Linings Playbook" is a Hollywood romantic comedy made to mask the horrific downside of mental illness while still giving the audience a little sense of superiority as they walk out of the cinema.
reviews.author: Cole Smithey

reviews.text: Silver Linings Playbook is all things to all moviegoers. Please join the queues circling the blocks.
reviews.author: Nigel Andrews

reviews.text: It should be unwatchable. But in the sure hands of America's most effervescent humanist director, David O. Russell, it's unmissable.
reviews.author: Jamie Dunn

reviews.text: A man's bi-polar disorder is supposed to give license to implausible and contrived histrionics.
reviews.author: Boo Allen

reviews.text: Silver Linings Playbook is always interesting and full of humanity in all its shades. It has plenty of black humour and it's superbly acted.
reviews.author: Roz Laws

reviews.text: Might at first look like proper cinema red in tooth and claw, but underneath it's a bundle of matted fleece and bleating.
reviews.author: Robbie Collin

reviews.text: A hugely enjoyable, warm-hearted romantic comedy-drama with a refreshing honesty towards its subject matter and a pair of terrific performances from Bradley Cooper and Jennifer Lawrence.
reviews.author: Matthew Turner

reviews.text: This is a date movie that doesn't offer the sophistication it thinks it does, but is as enjoyable and good-natured as the genre requires.
reviews.author: Peter Bradshaw

reviews.text: Certain movies are sprinkled with pixie dust, an indescribable concoction that infuses scenes with irresistible magic; Silver Linings Playbook is practically hand-rolled and deep-fried in the stuff.
reviews.author: Corey Hall

reviews.text: Silver Linings Playbook paves a highly entertaining road to recovery for its characters - one you will be glad to have helped sponsor.
reviews.author: Kofi Outlaw

reviews.text: With a truly awkward script and no chemistry between the leads this Thanksgiving arrival is a turkey.
reviews.author: Daniel M. Kimmel

reviews.text: While one respects the film for trying to juggle disparate tones, it never manages to find the proper balance.
reviews.author: Frank Swietek

reviews.text: Now, this isn't your typical rom-com. This doesn't have Sandra Bullock acting like an idiot for 90 minutes. This is a smart, edgy, brutally honest romance that will shake you up, but will have you hoping these characters will end up with each other.
reviews.author: Austin Kennedy

reviews.text: An interesting drama with a wonderful cast (especially Jennifer Lawrence), though it never quite reaches the depth and richness it strives for.
reviews.author: Clint O'Connor

reviews.text: Russell crafts a Baker Act romance playing loose and eccentric with the genre. The banter is spikier, wacky sidekicks have issues, too, and Pat and Tiffany's obstacles aren't fluff. The screws are tighter, and the movie is a ball.
reviews.author: Steve Persall

reviews.text: An edgy romantic dramedy that suits our anxious times.
reviews.author: Elizabeth Weitzman

reviews.text: Lawrence's bold performance and her fearlessly sexual character are more than Russell knows how to harness.
reviews.author: Sean P. Means

reviews.text: An intelligent and well-crafted film that seeks to inspire audiences by finding the humor amid the prevailing bittersweetness of life.
reviews.author: Mike Scott

reviews.text: Speaking of Oscars, the great DeNiro is great once again here.
reviews.author: Matthew Odam

reviews.text: With leads as winning as Cooper and Lawrence, and Russell's signature mix of clever and sincere dialogue, the hook is set.
reviews.author: Michael Burgin

reviews.text: This meaningful film keeps the laughs, giddy anxiousness and warm butterflies from the trailer and sustains it all through two full hours of a love story.
reviews.author: Ricardo Baca

reviews.text: Lawrence, in her most high-low, sad-comic turn yet, is remarkable.
reviews.author: Peter Rainer

reviews.text: Until the characters can take their needs seriously and laugh at themselves, at least a little, they're not going to be healthy. Playbook traces all their journeys from stubborn self-assertion to a fragile connectedness that might lead to lasting bonds.
reviews.author: Lawrence Toppman

reviews.text: With bold camera moves and jumps between scenes, there's an antic quality to "Silver Linings Playbook" that reaches all the way back to such 1930s screwball comedies as "Bringing Up Baby."
reviews.author: Chris Hewitt

reviews.text: It shouldn't work - there's just too much going on. But it does. Spectacularly. Go see it.
reviews.author: Tom Long

reviews.text: Just the sort of rom-com you'd expect from a director who once came to blows with George Clooney.
reviews.author: Elliott Noble

reviews.text: This is a really funny film with some great performances, but sadly the second half shows that Russell lost track of what was important in the story. This still balances out to a good movie, [but] it could have been great had it stayed on course.
reviews.author: Jeff Beck

reviews.text: The film is at once heartfelt and funny, farcical and sincere, and packed with performances that pull off that difficult balancing act. In short, it's a masterpiece.
reviews.author: Robert Levin

reviews.text: There's nothing wrong with the overrated Jennifer Lawrence that some serious acting lessons couldn't improve. The rest of the actors are pretty much on their own.
reviews.author: Rex Reed

reviews.text: For a movie that seems at times to have no idea what it's trying to do, "Silver Linings Playbook" is compulsively watchable.
reviews.author: Bill Goodykoontz

reviews.text: Unlike typical romantic genre fare, its jagged edges will make the characters and film a challenge for some viewers, which is the reason why others embrace it.
reviews.author: Duane Dudek

reviews.text: Sharp of tongue, generous of spirit, Silver Linings Playbook is a jagged, loopy romantic comedy about "crazy" people that insists, deep down, we're all a little nuts.
reviews.author: Chris Vognar

reviews.text: "The Silver Linings Playbook" defies categorization: it's both comedy and drama, without fitting neatly into either genre.
reviews.author: Moira MacDonald

reviews.text: The film is just as clumsy about psychological issues as Hollywood movies generally are, but Jennifer Lawrence's performance makes all that moot.
reviews.author: Liz Braun

reviews.text: David O. Russell's latest entertaining ode to lovable characters you should probably be afraid of.
reviews.author: Loey Lockerby

reviews.text: Going deep without resorting to trick plays, the sure-handed "Silver Linings Playbook" scores on every possession.
reviews.author: Joe Williams

reviews.text: Some movies are so likable, so naturally charming, that you'll forgive any dopey idea they throw at you.
reviews.author: Rafer Guzman

reviews.text: David O. Russell has pulled off a tricky feat here, finding just the right tone in crafting a romantic comedy whose sweethearts suffer from bipolar disorder and depression.
reviews.author: Christy Lemire

reviews.text: Silver Linings Playbook isn't perfect - the ending is untidy - but it may just be the year's best comedy.
reviews.author: Peter Howell

reviews.text: Pretty much a miscalculation from beginning to end.
reviews.author: David Denby

reviews.text: Silver Linings Playbook is a rare thing indeed - a romantic comedy that completely delivers on both sides of the equation.
reviews.author: Andy Lea

reviews.text: A deliriously funny and disarmingly poignant love story that's sure to brighten the outlook of even the hardest cynic.
reviews.author: Stella Papamichael

reviews.text: A well-paced and whip-smart screenplay.
reviews.author: Jeanne Kaplan

reviews.text: Russell's deft writing, and the ensemble cast, keep it light and entertaining.
reviews.author: David Kaplan

reviews.text: The ending is a bust, but there's a wealth of good stuff here.
reviews.author: Phil Brown

reviews.text: Cooper and Lawrence have a nice, believable chemistry, and by the time they get to the dance competition it's surprising how tense it is and much you are rooting for them.
reviews.author: Siobhan Synnot

reviews.text: Jennifer Lawrence is the standout in a tonally uneven, eccentric romantic dramedy that fuses The Fisher King with Romy And Michele's High School Reunion.
reviews.author: Damon Wise

reviews.text: Tinged with shadows and ignited by Lawrence and Cooper, Silver Linings Playbook raises the bar on romantic comedy. It's crazy good.
reviews.author: Peter Travers

reviews.text: It's lopsided and spotty, but it's alive in a way that suddenly makes you remember to what degree most Hollywood movies aren't.
reviews.author: Dana Stevens

reviews.text: Unlikely and engaging, this quirky, off-beat romantic dramedy is a cheerfully enjoyable crowd-pleaser.
reviews.author: Susan Granger

reviews.text: Silver Linings Playbook is Cooper and Lawrence's show.
reviews.author: Matt Patches

reviews.text: With Silver Linings Playbook, David O. Russell has again recalibrated, and achieved the quirky yet poignant balance of his best early work.
reviews.author: Christopher Orr

reviews.text: David O. Russell is screwing with us. He's seeing how many indie rom-com tropes he can juggle at the same time and still make it work, with one big twist: Brad Cooper is the Manic Pixie Dream Girl with a penis.
reviews.author: Vincent Mancini

reviews.text: It's smart, edgy, and filled with some of the best performances of the year
reviews.author: Brian Tallerico

reviews.text: Offbeat dramedy mixes light and dark; some intense moments.
reviews.author: S. Jhoanna Robledo

reviews.text: What starts off as a serious examination of mental illness turns into an entirely different movie, one with nearly the exact same third act as "High School Musical."
reviews.author: Stephen Silver

reviews.text: Contrived, but beautifully cast and very entertaining.
reviews.author: James Verniere

reviews.text: Pat and Tiffany's love story may only be possible in the movies, but damned if the actors don't make it seem real.
reviews.author: Ethan Alter

reviews.text: The title is the only clunky thing in this smart, witty film. Cooper & Lawrence find the balance between being likable and making us queasy. De Niro & Weaver are miraculous.
reviews.author: Caryn James

reviews.text: It's Lawrence who knocked me sideways. I loved her in Winter's Bone and The Hunger Games but she's very young - I didn't think she had this kind of deep-toned, layered weirdness in her.
reviews.author: David Edelstein

reviews.text: David O. Russell returns to his distinctive brand of neurotic screwball comedy, and like his early features Spanking the Monkey and Flirting With Disaster, this one somersaults giddily from sanity to insanity to sanity again.
reviews.author: J. R. Jones

reviews.text: Consistently funny and, as it builds to its conclusion, also very sweet fun.
reviews.author: Kimberley Jones

reviews.text: "Silver Linings" feels different and fresh, also sincere.
reviews.author: Gary Thompson

reviews.text: It's tiresome to hear reviewers hyping this or that funny movie as "the year's best," so I won't. But you get the idea.
reviews.author: Kurt Loder

reviews.text: 'Silver Linings Playbook' is fun, sharp and sometimes moving, but it's not reinventing any kind of wheel.
reviews.author: Glenn Kenny

reviews.text: Like a production of When Harry Met Sally put on by the characters from One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest. Silver Linings uses cliches like a straight-jacket, containing an otherwise nutty film and making it safe for audiences to approach.
reviews.author: Radheyan Simonpillai

reviews.text: It might be contrived that way, but we are willing to forgive and accept because the path to what we expect is rewarding.
reviews.author: Willie Waffle

reviews.text: Because of Lawrence, I just can't write off this movie.
reviews.author: Lou Lumenick

reviews.text: Would that every feel-good movie came by its good feelings so honestly.
reviews.author: Ann Hornaday

reviews.text: Silver Linings Playbook is, like its protagonist, hopelessly optimistic ... and it's a sign of the film's potency that we buy into it with our own sense of hopefulness.
reviews.author: Mark Dujsik

reviews.text: Beyond delivering an Oscar-worthy screenplay featuring some terrifically penned dialogue, Russell gets a great deal of help from his terrific cast. (Full Content Review for Parents also available)
reviews.author: Jim Judy

reviews.text: ... this is a film with its own cadence, its own particular sense of music, and it is a tremendous success for writer/director David O. Russell.
reviews.author: Drew McWeeny

reviews.text: A bittersweet romantic comedy, plain and simple, and, by the time it has added in subplots involving dance competitions and football superstitions, also rather unwieldy.
reviews.author: Dustin Putman

reviews.text: It's a strain to care about Pat, and it's impossible to believe in his world.
reviews.author: Mick LaSalle

reviews.text: To that lost and found actor list you can also add Good Script Choosing Robert De Niro, who had been kidnapped by aliens 20 years ago and swapped out for Awful Script Choosing Robert De Niro.
reviews.author: Phil Villarreal

reviews.text: An unfussy, rambling crowd-pleaser that recalls elements of the filmmaker's past work ...
reviews.author: Alison Willmore

reviews.text: Silver Linings is consistently entertaining, with its scrappy, well-drawn characters, offbeat humor and indefatigable positive outlook.
reviews.author: Claudia Puig

reviews.text: A healing and hopeful dramady about friendship. love, family, and optimism that is one of the Best Films of 2012.
reviews.author: Frederic and Mary Ann Brussat

reviews.text: The movie doesn't break any thematic ground, and in other hands this same material might have made for an insufferable Katherine Heigl vehicle. But Russell and his cast make it sing - and soar, too.
reviews.author: Rene Rodriguez

reviews.text: Dramatic, emotional, even heartbreaking, as well as wickedly funny, it has the gift of going its own way, a complete success from a singular talent.
reviews.author: Kenneth Turan

reviews.text: ...that rare thing, a top notch comedy orchestrated by a director with a talent for teasing out the unexpected.
reviews.author: Laura Clifford

reviews.text: Cooper's performance meets Lawrence's, beautifully, halfway.
reviews.author: Stephanie Zacharek

reviews.text: Everything comes together brilliantly in "Silver Linings Playbook"-for the film's crazed but uncrazy lovers; for the filmmaker, David O. Russell, and best of all for lucky us.
reviews.author: Joe Morgenstern

reviews.text: No matter how grim it's looking for certain kinds of laughter, as long as there's David O. Russell, things will be OK.
reviews.author: Wesley Morris

reviews.text: "Silver Linings Playbook," the exuberant new movie from David O. Russell, does almost everything right.
reviews.author: Manohla Dargis

reviews.text: Silver Linings Playbook is an infectiously rousing crowd-pleaser about psychological damage and emotional healing, which would seem oxymoronic if not for the authentic, insightful atmosphere and marvelous performances.
reviews.author: Jonathan Lack

reviews.text: Anyone seeking proof that a movie can transcend its subject should look to Silver Linings Playbook.
reviews.author: Ben Kenigsberg

reviews.text: It's clever and cute and never lets you forget it, winning in spite of how much it insists on it.
reviews.author: Sam Adams

reviews.text: Cooper's much better than usual, while the always-great Lawrence is particularly fantastic.
reviews.author: Matt Pais

reviews.text: I say good for Russell for risking a protagonist who requires some patience and forgiveness.
reviews.author: Michael Phillips

reviews.text: It's the perfect material for Russell, who not only deals perceptively with the dizzying swings of manic depression, but makes it the fabric of a big, generous, happy-making ensemble comedy.
reviews.author: Scott Tobias

reviews.text: "Silver Linings Playbook" is so good, it could almost be a terrific old classic.
reviews.author: Roger Ebert

reviews.text: While the ultimate takeaway from Silver Linings Playbook is, as the title suggests, optimistic, it's not just because the film has two recognizable stars and a cutesy premise.
reviews.author: William Bibbiani

reviews.text: A solid cast delivers in a movie that is thoroughly enjoyable if not consistently great.
reviews.author: Kristian Harloff

reviews.text: It's not often that a movie can affect you and make you laugh out loud all at once, but "Silver Linings Playbook" coordinates the task with ease.
reviews.author: Mark Ellis

reviews.text: Most of the way, the film's deficiencies are survivable if only for Jennifer Lawrence and some fleeting moments of emotional clarity and bracing conflict.
reviews.author: Mark Keizer

reviews.text: Russell pitches the action at a manic, screwball pace, and the cast is more than up to the task, with Cooper and Lawrence attracting and repelling each other with equal dynamism.
reviews.author: Alonso Duralde

reviews.text: "Playbook" walks a tightrope in how it portrays mental illness -- deriving humor out of its characters' actions while demonstrating just how deep-rooted their problems are.
reviews.author: Randy Myers

reviews.text: I'll admit it. I went "yaaaay!" too. But I felt dirty doing it.
reviews.author: Jordan Hoffman

reviews.text: A razor sharp, unfiltered exploration of recovery and reconciliation.
reviews.author: Mark Sells

reviews.text: Manic as it might be stylistically, emotionally Silver Linings Playbook maintains too even of a keel.
reviews.author: Karina Longworth

reviews.text: David O Russell's movie to love raises the bar on what has become the traditional rom-com.
reviews.author: Joanna Langfield

reviews.text: The acting is sparky and intelligent, with Cooper proving there's more to him than flashy good looks. As for Lawrence, she acts every role like there's a soulful storm raging inside of her.
reviews.author: Cath Clarke

reviews.text: It's impossible to shake the sense that what felt thrillingly, cohesively alive in the director's earlier movies plays here with more laurel-resting creakiness than go-for-broke verve.
reviews.author: Keith Uhlich

reviews.text: It manages to positively bleed compassion while remaining light, sexy, dynamic and thought-provoking.
reviews.author: Hannah McGill

reviews.text: Silver Linings Playbook is a quirky adult romantic comedy that goes beyond the standard rhythms of the genre.
reviews.author: James Berardinelli

reviews.text: Silver Linings Playbook is a neurotic ode to family dysfunction and accepting the universal screwup in all of us, which is to say it's maybe the most heartwarming movie you'll ever see about bipolarity.
reviews.author: Liam Lacey

reviews.text: Turning frantic relationship problems into breezy entertainment, Russell gives Silver Linings Playbook the air of a classic romcom, strengthening it with the type of sophisticated insight into human behavior that Preston Sturges might make today.
reviews.author: Eric Kohn

reviews.text: A delightful romantic comedy with unusually dark underpinnings.
reviews.author: Kevin Lally

reviews.text: Russell has a way of transforming what should be clichéd stories into something surprising and insightful..it earns its feel-good status, rather than manufactures it.
reviews.author: Marshall Fine

reviews.text: A thoroughly annoying and staggeringly laughless quirkfest featuring the most alarmingly miscast role of 2012.
reviews.author: Erick Weber

reviews.text: Lawrence goes Nicolas Cage crazy in her key moments. However, she kind of shows the most when she goes dead eyed.
reviews.author: Fred Topel

reviews.text: When one stops to consider how irksomely on the nose so much of this is, the qualities which intend to most readily ingratiate the film with us begin to appear perceptibly disingenuous and false.
reviews.author: Calum Marsh

reviews.text: Makes the life of a film critic that little bit easier by setting 90% of the drama, action and dialogue literally in the middle of the road.
reviews.author: Charlie Lyne

reviews.text: While the movie follows the rom-com template overall, the awards-worthy acting of the two principals and the hyper pace of the action make this a must-see.
reviews.author: Harvey S. Karten

reviews.text: Silver Linings Playbook is the sort of feel-good claptrap that normally irritates me, but Russell plays it with the pitch and verve of a classic screwball comedy.
reviews.author: Devin Faraci

reviews.text: A head-spinning wonder of a movie about love and pain, reclamation and the totemic power of a National Football League franchise.
reviews.author: Steven Rea

reviews.text: As its nutty lovebirds, Cooper and Lawrence save Playbook from the director's surprisingly mundane impulses.
reviews.author: Rob James

reviews.text: Only a man with a celebrated history of behind-the-scenes altercations with movie stars and a prominent YouTube video of his on-set ravings could possibly mastermind a marvelous feature like Silver Linings Playbook.
reviews.author: Brian Orndorf

reviews.text: David O. Russell delivers wonderfully left-of-center entertainment time and time again and this is no exception. But this is a film that ultimately belongs to Jennifer Lawrence, thus solidifying her as one of the best actresses of any age working today.
reviews.author: Erik Childress

reviews.text: Appealing and enjoyable, David O. Russell's serio comedy is extremely well acted, likely to be embraced by critics, viewers, and Oscar voters.
reviews.author: Emanuel Levy

reviews.text: Few films in recent memory have effectively pulled at the heartstrings like this.
reviews.author: Sam Fragoso

reviews.text: With great pacing, a great sense of the moment and some of the most entertaining one-liners you'll find this side of a Coen brothers' film, there's much to like about Silver Linings Playbook.
reviews.author: Laremy Legel

reviews.text: A hilarious, romantic and heartfelt crowd pleaser with genuinely great performances makes for one of the first must-see films of the Fall.
reviews.author: David Baldwin

reviews.text: David O. Russell has turned Matthew Quick's novel into an easily accessible romantic comedy that pulls you in with its immediacy.
reviews.author: Edward Douglas

reviews.text: It's a crowd-pleaser if I've ever seen one, and something that will have plenty of mileage come awards season. A best picture nomination seems a lock.
reviews.author: Chris Bumbray

reviews.text: The performances of these actors are reason enough to go.
reviews.author: Richard Corliss

reviews.text: Bradley Cooper and Jennifer Lawrence expand their range in David O. Russell's winning comedy romance about two people struggling to rebuild their lives.
reviews.author: David Rooney

reviews.text: In a script that never lapses into mundane or uninteresting language, the scenes between Pat and Tiffany are sculpted with an almost David Mamet-like sharpness.
reviews.author: Justin Chang

synopsis: After losing his job and wife, and spending time in a mental institution, Pat Solatano (Bradley Cooper) winds up living with his parents (Robert De Niro, Jacki Weaver). He wants to rebuild his life and reunite with his wife, but his parents would be happy if he just shared their obsession with the Philadelphia Eagles. Things get complicated when Pat meets Tiffany (Jennifer Lawrence), who offers to help him reconnect with his wife, if he will do something very important for her in exchange.
